intro: Smelowskia sisymbrioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain the seeds. Smelowskia sisymbrioides is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of arid or semi-arid environments.
